criteria: Application of Injury Prevention in Different Settings
Advocacy and Promotion of Injury Prevention
descriptions: Demonstrates no understanding of injury prevention strategies.
Shows a limited understanding of injury prevention strategies; struggles to identify relevant examples.
Identifies some injury prevention strategies but lacks depth in explaining how they work.
Demonstrates a solid understanding of various injury prevention strategies and can explain them adequately.
Exhibits a comprehensive understanding of injury prevention strategies and provides detailed explanations.
Displays an exceptional understanding of injury prevention strategies and can articulate their importance with clarity and insight.
Unable to apply injury prevention knowledge to real-world scenarios.
Struggles to apply injury prevention knowledge to different settings (school, home, community).
Can apply injury prevention knowledge to one or two settings but not consistently across all.
Applies injury prevention strategies to school, home, and community settings with reasonable accuracy.
Effectively applies injury prevention strategies to various settings, demonstrating adaptability.
Expertly applies injury prevention strategies to diverse settings, tailoring approaches for maximum effectiveness.
Shows no effort to advocate for or promote injury prevention.
Demonstrates minimal effort to advocate for injury prevention.
Participates in basic advocacy efforts with limited enthusiasm.
Actively advocates for injury prevention and promotes its importance.
Demonstrates leadership in advocating for injury prevention, inspiring others to take action.
Leads comprehensive injury prevention initiatives, creating a culture of safety and well-being.
